get.summary: Returns all the pending connection and saved drafts with their most recent state that have been invited and all the connection requests that have been received from the peers along with the date and time the most recent state. The pending connections are listed in a chronological order (the invitation sent or invitation recd whose state was created / updated most recently is at the top of the list).

401.description: Invalid API Key included in the request

500.description: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

400.description: A required parameter was missing in the request

401.description: Invalid API Key included in the request

500.description: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

get.summary:
Returns all the connection (contacts) which were accepted by the peer (invitee) and all the connections which have been accepted by the LOB with the date and time the
connection was established. The connection (contacts) are listed in alphabetical order (Given Name).

400.description: A required parameter was missing in the request

401.description: Invalid API Key included in the request

500.description: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

info.title: Orbit Enterprise Connection
info.description: Connection API is a SAAS service that entity uses to connect with peer entities. Connection API is applicable only where both parties support DIDComm (AIP 1.0 or AIP 2.0) protocol.

message.example: A required parameter was missing in the request
Invalid API Key included in the request
The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

givenName.description: The name of the individual initiating the DID exchange request.

publicDID.description: The public DID of the requester to be used for the DID exchange.

givenName.description: The name of the individual involved in the DID exchange.

messageProtocol.description: The protocol version used for the DID exchange. For example, AIP 2.0.

publicDID.description: The public DID associated with the exchange participant.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

givenName.description: The name or label the invitee gives to the inviter / recipient when invitee sends the oob invitation, oob credential offer, oob proof request or when the recipient accepts the oob invitation it gives to the oob invitation invitee

messageProtocol.description: The protocol in which the message should be sent and is specified by the sender of the message

state.description:
Specify the status filter criteria based on which the records are retrieved (for example “proposal-sent”). The status is specific to what records are being retrieved (for example credential offers or proof request, etc).

state also returns the state of invitation or credential exchange interaction with the peer identity.

longUrl.description:
The URL can be of three types:
1. long invitation URL that the inviter can send to the invitee
2. long credential offer URL that issuer can send to the recipient
3. long proof request URL that verifier can send to the holder

shortUrl.description:
The URL can be of three types:
1. short invitation URL that the inviter can send to the invitee
2. short credential offer URL that issuer can send to the recipient
3. short proof request URL that verifier can send to the holder

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

givenName.description: The name or label the invitee gives to the inviter / recipient when invitee sends the oob invitation, oob credential offer, oob proof request or when the recipient accepts the oob invitation it gives to the oob invitation invitee

messageProtocol.description: The protocol in which the message should be sent and is specified by the sender of the message

recipientEmail.description: This email is used to send oob invitation, oob credential offer and oob proof request.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

url.description:
The URL can be of three types:
1. long invitation URL that the inviter can send to the invitee
2. short invitation URL that inviter can send to the invitee

messageProtocol.description: The protocol in which the message should be sent and is specified by the sender of the message

theirLabel.description: The label the oob invitation recipient receives alongwith the invitation URL received

invitationId.description: This is the ID for the invitation an identity has sent to another identity to establish a connection.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

invitationId.description: The ID of the invitation to accept.

givenName.description: The name of the user accepting the connection.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

invitationId.description: The unique identifier for the invitation record.

connectionId.description: The unique connection ID assigned to this invitation.

lobName.description: The name of the organization or service involved in the connection.

givenName.description: The given name of the invitee.

messageProtocol.description: The communication protocol used for this connection.

theirDid.description: The DID of the recipient in the connection.

myRole.description: The role of the current user in this connection.

theirRole.description: The role of the other party in the connection.

recipientEmail.description: The email address of the recipient.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the invitation was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the invitation record was last updated.

exchangeId.description: Exchange ID associated with this connection.

totalItems.description: The total number of items available in the dataset.

itemCount.description: The number of items on the current page.

limit.description: The maximum number of items displayed per page.

totalPages.description: The total number of pages available based on the dataset and limit.

currentPage.description: The current page number that the user is viewing.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

givenName.description: The full name of the contact.

email.description: The email address of the contact, if provided.

phone.description: The phone number of the contact, if available.

logo.description: A URL pointing to the logo or profile picture of the contact.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

id.description: The unique ID of the pending contact.

givenName.description: The given name of the pending contact.

role.description: The role of the pending contact.

email.description: The email address associated with the pending contact.

phone.description: The phone number associated with the pending contact.

logo.description: The logo associated with the pending contact.

piiVCId.description: The PII (Personally Identifiable Information) VC ID associated with the pending contact.

createdAt.description: The creation timestamp for the pending contact.

updatedAt.description: The last updated timestamp for the pending contact.

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response
